classes

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a hand in blackjack. Hands contain cards and the dealer and each player have a hand. Each hand has a value based on the cards that are associated to it.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand 
      private int nrCards 
      private int totalValue 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand(Card c1, Card c2, boolean visib)
      Creates a new Hand, receives two cards and if the second card should be turned up or down (if it's the dealer's first hand).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public Hand(Card c1,
            Card c2,
            boolean visib)
        Creates a new Hand, receives two cards and if the second card should be turned up or down (if it's the dealer's first hand).
        Parameters:
        c1 - 1st card to be added
        c2 - 2nd card to be added
        visib - true if both cards are turned up false if the 2nd should be turned down

    • Method Detail

      • getNrCards

        int getNrCards()
        Return the number of cards in the hand.
        Returns:
        number of cards

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getTotalValue

        int getTotalValue()
        Returns the value of the hand as it is.
        Returns:
        total value

      • setTotalValue

        private void setTotalValue(int totalValue)
        Sets the total value of the hand, havin in account the possibility of the ace value being 1 or 11.
        Parameters:
        totalValue - new value of the hand

      • addCard

        void addCard(Card c)
        Adds a card to the hand, updates the total value of the hand and increments the number of cards in the hand.
        Parameters:
        c - Card to be added to the hand

      • removeCard

        void removeCard()
        Removes the 2nd card of the hand, updates the total value of the hand and the number of cards. This method is only used when a split is detected.

      • turnCard

        void turnCard()
        Turns up the 2nd card of the hand. This method is used if a card is turned down due to it being assigned to the dealer's 2nd card and it's not supposed to be turned down anymore.

      • checkInsurance

        int checkInsurance()
        Checks if an insurance is possible to be made.
        Returns:
        1 if is possible to insure 0 otherwise

      • getCard

        Card getCard(int index)
        Gets the card of a certain position in the hand.
        Parameters:
        index - position of the card to be returned
        Returns:
        the card in the chosen position
